definition: to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Wen
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at

sentences.english: But the mother did not seem to hear it.
sentences.chinese: 但作母親的好象對此聽而不聞。

sentences.english: He always turns a deaf ear to other people's criticism.
sentences.chinese: 他對別人對他的批評總是聽而不聞。

sentences.english: Their appeals fall on deaf ears and the offensive items are given away.
sentences.chinese: 她們的控訴被聽而不聞，這些冒犯的物件被扔掉。
他們視而不見，聽而不聞。
她對這句話也聽而不聞。

sentences.english: Jawboning from the Japanese government continued overnight although the markets are hardly listening.
sentences.chinese: 日本政府隔夜繼續口頭干預，但市場幾乎聽而不聞。

definition: to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
way of life/attitude/modus operandi
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to like to lecture others (idiom)
argumentative/quarrelsome
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
compassion/empathetic
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
(literary) hypocrite/two-faced person
at one's ease/carefree
